doc.content: Stewart participated in all of the Squadron's activities, including its decision to implement their "Utopia Program," whereby they intended to eliminate all the major problems besetting their nation, such as crime and hunger. Stewart also joined several members of the team in publicly revealing their identities as a gesture of good faith.After several months of implementing the program, the Squadron was openly opposed by the Redeemers, a team dedicated to opposing the Squadron's "Utopian" rule. The battle was devastating, and the Squadron was convinced to dismantle the Utopia Program.Before the Squadron could fully dismantle their program, a white being of immense size began to grow and threaten to devour the Sun. Members of the Squadron, including the Whizzer, sought help from various avenues and boarded a space ship to battle their mysterious foe. The threat was thwarted thanks to Arcanna's newborn son, but when the team tried to return to Earth, they found themselves exiled to the Avengers' reality. Stewart stood by the other Squadron members during their time trapped on Earth.
doc.identity: Publicly known to the people of Earth-712
doc.powers: Whizzer has superhuman speed, reflexes, and endurance. The Whizzer also has resistance to the detrimental effects of friction caused by air.
significantissues: alongside four other Squadron members was dispatched by government agents under the domination of the Serpent Crown to Earth-616, subdued five Avengers (Avengers #141, 1975)
arrived on Earth-616, attacked Quasar, brainwashed by Over-Mind (Quasar #13, 1991)
searched Stranger's lab world for the Stranger (Quasar #14, 1991)
alongside other brainwashed Sqaudron members attacked Hyperion, Quasar and Makarri (Quasar #15, 1991)
s control, settled at Project: PEGASUS (Quasar #16, 1991)
competed in marathon race against various 616 speedsters, lost to Makkari and Fastforward (Quasar #17, 1992)

returned to Earth-712 with the Squadron, confronted by Mysterium, informed of the Global Directorate, settled on Utopia Isle (
Squadron Supreme: New World Order, 1998)
witnessed the Squadron's trial of the Exiles, learned about the Exiles history and the Global Directorate's treachery, helped the Squadron oust the Global Directorate from power (Exiles #78, 2006)
